title: Tanacetum microphyllum
text:
Tanacetum microphyllum is a species of flowering plant in the aster family, <a href="Asteraceae">Asteraceae</a>. It is <a href="endemism">endemic</a> to the <a href="Iberian%20Peninsula">Iberian Peninsula</a>.
The plant has been used for centuries in <a href="spain">Spanish</a> <a href="traditional%20medicine">traditional medicine</a> as an <a href="anti-inflammatory">anti-inflammatory</a> and <a href="Disease-modifying%20antirheumatic%20drug">antirheumatic</a>. Compounds isolated from extracts of the plant include <a href="Santin%20%28flavonol%29">santin</a>, <a href="ermanin">ermanin</a>, <a href="centaureidin">centaureidin</a>, and <a href="hydroxyachillin">hydroxyachillin</a>.
